title: Great location near Subway, 9/11
text:
Stayed at the Holiday Inn Manhattan Financial District for three nights over Presidents Day Weekend.
The property, as the world's tallest Holiday Inn, is 50 floors high in the Financial District. The location is actually prime; one block away from the Freedom Tower and 9/11 Memorial Museum, and one block away from the subway station (Rector Street) which will take you right into the heart of the action. From the hotel, I found it very easy to access Times Square, MoMA, and the Whitney Museum of American Art. I was a little apprehensive about staying in FiDi, but it worked out great.
Check-in was very cheerful. I read a lot of complains about "waiting 15 minutes for the elevator" but have no idea what people are complaining about. It is a 50-story building with high-speed elevators. With almost 500 rooms, it can be busy, but at most you are waiting two minutes.
My room was a King View room on the corner of the 46th floor. Overlooking the Hudson and 9/11 memorial, the view was stunning. I would recommend spending a couple extra dollars and upgrading to a room with a view. There are also some people complaining about the rooms being small, which I find odd. The rooms are actually quite large for NYC. They were well-designed, with new furnishings, a comfortable mattress and fantastic shower.
Wifi was very reliable and easy to sign on. All staff I encountered were friendly and happy to help. Room service was also pretty good.
I can admittedly be a bit of a hotel snob, and the Holiday Inn FiDi really hit everything well. When returning to Manhattan, I will be staying here again. Thank you for a great stay!
